question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Find $4321_{7}-123_{7}+32_{7}-21_{7}+1_{7}$. Express your answer in base $7$.

To find $4321_{7}-123_{7}+32_{7}-21_{7}+1_{7}$, we first convert each number to base 10.
$4321_{7} = 4(7^3)+3(7^2)+2(7^1)+1(7^0) = 4(343) + 3(49) + 2(7) + 1(1) = 1372 + 147 + 14 + 1 = 1534$
$123_{7} = 1(7^2)+2(7^1)+3(7^0) = 1(49) + 2(7) + 3(1) = 49 + 14 + 3 = 66$
$32_{7} = 3(7^1) + 2(7^0) = 3(7) + 2(1) = 21 + 2 = 23$
$21_{7} = 2(7^1) + 1(7^0) = 2(7) + 1(1) = 14 + 1 = 15$
$1_{7} = 1$
Now we have $1534 - 66 + 23 - 15 + 1 = 1468 + 23 - 15 + 1 = 1491 - 15 + 1 = 1476 + 1 = 1477$
Now we convert 1477 to base 7.
$1477 \div 7 = 211 + \text{remainder } 0$
$211 \div 7 = 30 + \text{remainder } 1$
$30 \div 7 = 4 + \text{remainder } 2$
$4 \div 7 = 0 + \text{remainder } 4$
Reading the remainders from bottom to top, we get $4210_{7}$.

$4321_{7}-123_{7} = 1534-66=1468$
$1468+23=1491$
$1491-15=1476$
$1476+1=1477$
Convert $1477$ to base 7.
$1477 \div 7 = 211$ with remainder $0$
$211 \div 7 = 30$ with remainder $1$
$30 \div 7 = 4$ with remainder $2$
$4 \div 7 = 0$ with remainder $4$
So $1477 = 4210_7$

Final Answer: $\boxed{4210_7}$
